stork.feather.net

Class Socket

  • java.lang.Object
    • stork.feather.net.Coder<byte[],byte[]>
      • stork.feather.net.Socket

  • public abstract class Socket
extends Coder<byte[],byte[]>
    An asynchrounous network connection. For connection-oriented sockets, this can be used either to make an outgoing connection, or to accept incoming connections (using the accept(Socket) method). For connectionless sockets, this can be used to either send data or receive incoming data.

      • accept

        protected void accept(Socket socket)
        Handle an incoming connection. This will only be called on connection-oriented sockets after listening has begun. Throwing an exception here will cause the socket to be closed.
        Parameters:
        socket - a Socket which has just been accepted.

      • close

        public final Socket close()
        Close the socket.

      • close

        public final Socket close(Throwable reason)
        Close the socket for the given reason.

      • closeOn

        public final Socket closeOn(Bell<?> bell)
        Close the socket when bell rings.

      • onClose

        public final Bell<Socket> onClose()
        Return a bell that rings when the socket is opened.

      • isClosed

        public final boolean isClosed()
        Check if the channel is closed.

      • doConnect

        protected abstract Bell<?> doConnect()
                              throws Exception
        Handle asynchronously connecting the socket. This will be called at most once.
        Returns:
        A bell which should ring when the connection has been established or has failed to be established. If cancelled, the connection process should be halted.
        Throws:
        Exception - If a problem happens immediately.

      • doListen

        protected abstract Bell<?> doListen()
                             throws Exception
        Handle starting listening on the socket. This will be called at most once.
        Returns:
        A bell which should ring when the socket has begun listening or has failed to start listening. If cancelled, the connection process should be halted.
        Throws:
        Exception - If a problem happens immediately.

      • doClose

        protected abstract void doClose()
                         throws Exception
        Handle closing this socket. This will be called at most once.
        Throws:
        Exception - Any exception thrown will be ignored.
